content: तद् {%<ab>pron. a.</ab>%} (<ab>Nom.</ab> <ab>sing.</ab> सः {%<ab>m.</ab>%}, सा {%<ab>f.</ab>%}, तत् {%<ab>n.</ab>%}) {@--1@} That, referring to something not present; (तदिति परोक्षे विजानीयात्). {@--2@} He, she, it; (<ab>oft.</ab> as corr. of यद्); यस्य बुद्धिर्बलं तस्य <ls>Pt. 1.</ls> {@--3@} That, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} wellknown; सा रम्या नगरी महान्स नृपतिः सामंतचक्रं च तत् <ls>Bh. 3. 37</ls>; <ls>Ku. 5. 71.</ls> {@--4@} That (referring to something seen or experienced before, अनुभूतार्थः); उत्कांपिनी भयपरिस्खलितांशुकांता ते लोचने प्रतिदिशं विधुरे क्षिपंती <ls>K. P. 7</ls>; <ls>Bv. 2. 5.</ls> {@--5@} The same, identical, that, very; usually with एव; तानींद्रियाणि सकलानि तदेव नाम <ls>Bh. 2. 40.</ls> Sometimes the form of तद् are used with the first and second personal pronouns, as well as with demonstratives and relatives, for the sake of emphasis; (often translatable by ‘therefore’, ‘then’); सोहमिज्याविशुद्धात्मा <ls>R. 1. 69</ls>; ‘I that very person’, ‘I therefore’; (I who am so and so); स त्वं निवर्तस्व विहाय लज्जां <ls n="R.">2. 40</ls> ‘thou, therefore, shouldst return’, &c. When repeated तद् has the sense of ‘several’, ‘various’; तेषु तेषु स्थानेषु <ls>K. 369</ls>; <ls>Bg. 7. 20</ls>; <ls>Māl. 1. 36</ls>; ते ते भावाः <ls n="Māl.">1. 17.</ls> तेन the <ab>instr.</ab> of तद् is often used with adverbial force in the sense of ‘therefore’, ‘on that account, in that case’, ‘for that reason.’ तेन हि if so, well then. {%--<ab>ind.</ab>%} {@--1@} There, thither. {@--2@} Then, in that case, at that time. {@--3@} For that reason, therefore, consequently; तदेहि विमर्दक्षमां भूमिमवतरावः <ls>U. 5</ls>; <ls>Me. 7</ls>, <ls n="Me.">109</ls>: <ls>R. 3. 46.</ls> {@--4@} Then (corr. of यदि); तथापि यदि महत्कुतूहलं तत्कथयामि <ls>K. 136</ls>; <ls>Bg. 1. 46.</ls> {%--<ab>n.</ab>%} {@--1@} The Supreme Spirit or Brahman. {@--2@} This world.
